body.p: Analysis of the way the Linux project is run.

Shows that it is possible to control a large group of developers without formal relations.
In 1997, a group of leaders of the free software community assembled.
Their concern was to find a way to promote the ideas surrounding free software.
They were concerned that the Free Software Foundation's anti-business message was keeping the world from really appreciating the power of free software.
The group agreed that what they lacked was a marketing campaign, a campaign to win mind share, not just market share.
They defined a new term to describe the software they were promoting: Open Source.
